meanings.definition: A person or thing that reacts.
meanings.sent1: My friend is always the reactors in our group, responding quickly to any situation.
meanings.sent2: The reactors in the experiment showed a strong emotional response to the news.
meanings.sent3: The toy robot was programmed to be a reactors, jumping at sudden movements.
meanings.sent4: Her dog was a reactors to her every command, eager to please.
meanings.sent5: The reactors in the play was the character who always had a dramatic response to everything.

meanings.definition: A device used to induce or control nuclear reactions.
meanings.sent1: The nuclear reactors at the power plant generate electricity for the city.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are constantly researching new ways to improve nuclear reactors.
meanings.sent3: The malfunctioning reactors caused a stir among the engineers at the facility.
meanings.sent4: The nuclear reactors hummed softly as they worked to produce energy.
meanings.sent5: The nuclear reactors stood tall and imposing against the skyline, a symbol of power and innovation.

meanings.definition: A vessel or apparatus in which substances are reacted.
meanings.sent1: The chemistry lab had a variety of reactors for different experiments.
meanings.sent2: The glass reactors were carefully monitored during the chemical reaction.
meanings.sent3: The reactors bubbled and fizzed as the two substances combined.
meanings.sent4: The metal reactors were heated to high temperatures to speed up the reaction.
meanings.sent5: The reactors in the lab were essential for studying chemical changes in substances.
